meanings.definition: (noun) a straight line that is neither vertical nor horizontal, connecting two opposite corners of a shape
meanings.sent1: The carpenter drew a diagonal across the square piece of wood.
meanings.sent2: The artist sketched a diagonal line from one corner to the other.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat left a trail of diagonal scratches on the sofa.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze followed a diagonal path through the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The kite soared high, tethered to a bright red diagonal string.

meanings.definition: (adjective) slanting or inclined at an angle
meanings.sent1: She placed the diagonal board against the wall.
meanings.sent2: The roof had a diagonal slope that shed rainwater efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a diagonal slice missing, thanks to the sneaky dog.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting slanted diagonally across the page.
meanings.sent5: The tree's shadow fell in a diagonal pattern on the sidewalk.

meanings.definition: (verb) to move or extend in a diagonal direction
meanings.sent1: The knight would diagonal across the chessboard to capture the pawn.
meanings.sent2: She watched the ball diagonal swiftly towards the goal.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to diagonal up the tree trunk instead of taking the usual route.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to diagonal through the valley, cutting a path of its own.
meanings.sent5: The airplane started to diagonal upwards into the clear blue sky.
